title: Computer Science Through Stories: Foundations of Java Programming

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Fundamental Programming Concepts and High School-Level Computer Science Knowledge
context.additional_context: For pre-service and in-service teachers, combining core Java programming concepts with story-based learning activities. Designed to help learners acquire teaching methods applicable in real educational settings

learning_goals: Learners can explain the basic syntax of the Java programming language (variables, control statements, classes, objects, etc.) through story-based activities.
Learners can analyze problem situations embedded in stories and write appropriate algorithms and code.
Learners can propose instructional design plans to apply computer science concepts acquired from stories to real educational settings.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
